prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. Find the sum of $111_4+323_4+132_4$. Express your answer in base $4$.
solution: Since $1_4+3_4+2_4=12_4$, we carry over the $1$. Then we have $1_4+1_4+2_4+3_4=13_4$, so we carry over another $1$. For the leftmost column, we have $1_4+1_4+3_4+1_4=12_4$. In column format, this reads $$ \begin{array}{c@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & & _{1} &_{1}&\\ & & & 1& 1 & 1_4\\ & & & 3 & 2 & 3_4\\& & + & 1 & 3 & 2_4\\ \cline{2-6} & & 1 & 2 & 3& 2_4\\ \end{array} $$The sum is $\boxed{1232_4}$.
gpt_response:
Okay, so first we need to add the numbers together like this:

$$
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
& & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
& + & 3 & 2 & 3 \\
& + & 1 & 3 & 2 \\
\cline{2-5}
& 1 & 0 & 4 & 0 \\
\end{array}
$$

So, the sum of $111_4 + 323_4 + 132_4$ is $1040_4$.
